channel.title: Need Advice
channel.description:
Okay, I'm writing this because IDK what to do.
It's about skipping classes at school. AKA; Jigging, wag, etc.
Okay, so last year I jigged a lot of days, around 109 to be specific.
Throughout that year I had gotten around 8-10 Letters for jigging.
So the other day me and 3 mates got pulled by 2 police, and they took our names, ID's, etc. They then said "Go back to school now, we will be checking if you are there."
So, I know it's stupid but we didn't go back (this was on a monday)
Next day of school I went to first period, just to check if a teacher would come to my class about yesterdays "incident". Anyways, 4 days later on a friday, they got me out of my class took me to office, there I saw the other 2 who jigged with me.
I mean seriously, 4 days later they call back...
Anyways, they said this was our last chance, and made us sign some Home School shit... So, I went whole day of school on Monday & Tuesday I went 4 out of the 5 periods.
Now, IDK how the fuck I got caught today but when I got home today around 2 o'clock, phone rang and I answered it (this is about 5-10minutes ago)
and it was my Principal, she asked for my mum. My mum wasn't home,
But she said she will call back.
Now, my mum arrived home bout 2 minutes ago and she asked me why I'm home so early, and I just said "it's tuesday"...
Now, wtf should I do? there gonna call back and this is my last chance or Home Schooling + My mum is home :(
I'm in year 9. Please, advice.

item.title: Need Advice
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

Yes sir.

Read full topic

item.title: Need Advice
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

Rather than skipping, go to school. Problem solved.

Read full topic

item.title: Need Advice
item.dc:creator: @T3arful T3arful
item.description:
@T3arful wrote:

protip: go to school.
If you don’t, you’re probably going to end up a slob living off of benefits for most of your life. Getting a job these days is hard and probably will be for a while. Go get some qualifications.

Also, why are you skipping school? I’ve had my fair bit off of school over the years (Around 85-90% attendance each year) and I regret it now.
It’s going to bite you on the ass when you have to do your exams.

Read full topic

item.description:
@ChaosPkers wrote:

no school, get a job if u can? im sure ur busted by now tho

Read full topic

item.title: Need Advice
item.dc:creator: @rip4d rip4d
item.description:
@rip4d wrote:

Go to school and deal with it. You’ll be lucky if you can even get a job as a cashier at this point, because stupid decisions now can totally screw up your life in the long run.

Read full topic

item.title: Need Advice
item.dc:creator: @The_Reaper_X The Reaper X
item.description:
@The_Reaper_X wrote:

[quote=“Stupit, post:29, topic:333012”][quote author=The Reaper X link=topic=429433.msg3153258#msg3153258 date=1268770122]

This is literally the dumbest thing I’ve heard in a while. I’m sorry, but that’s more than half of your year that you’ve skipped, what do you mean “IDK HOW THEY CAUGHT ME THIS TIME.” ? You’ve missed a substantial amount of days, I’m sure it’s not hard to figure out that you’ve skipped if your not at school. And how the hell do you skip the day they tell you to go back?

Also, homeschooling is definitely not $1,000. There’s seriously no hope for you, unless your school is willing to be lenient a 110th time.

Homeschooling can actually get more pricey than that depending on where you buy the books or go through. My cuz is home-schooled and his mom pays about $1500 per child, for my cuz and his sister, for the books and such. Although, i was home-schooled for about 6 months for the low price of $200. It just depends on where you look to get the stuff from.
[/quote]$1,000 a week?

1,000$ a year maybe.[/quote]OP says a week, which is why I’m calling bullshit. =\

Either way, I don’t see how you can ditch ~100 days and get away with it.

Read full topic

My cuz is home-schooled and his mom pays about $1500 per child, for my cuz and his sister, for the books and such. Although, i was home-schooled for about 6 months for the low price of $200. It just depends on where you look to get the stuff from.
